Collect Now Changes--> <!--09/12/2014 2.0.29 Shravan Updated to add 2 optional fields in orderHeader complex element of submitOrder request--> <!--05/12/2014 2.0.28 Shravan Updated to add 3 optional the element type of cardnumber to maskedCardNumberType in initalpaymentsDetails--> <!--7/11/2014 2.1.25 Shravan Updated to introduce two new optional complex elements 'orderPartyDetails' and xmlns:xcore="http://soa.o2.co.uk/coredata_1" xmlns:mod="http://soa.o2.co.uk/manageorderdata_2" xmlns:pcp="http://soa.o2.co.uk/pscommonpostpaydata_2"> <xsd:import namespace="http://soa.o2.co.uk/coredata_1" schemaLocation="coredata_1_1.xsd"/> <xsd:import namespace="http://soa.o2.co.uk/pscommonpostpaydata_2" schemaLocation="pscommonpostpaydata_2_0.xsd"/> <xsd:element name="getOrderList" type="mod:getOrderList"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation could return a list of orders for one of the following parameters, 1. The user portal id on the O2 Registration Platform 2. An internal unique user identifier on the O2 registration Platform 3. <xsd:documentation>This service updates the status of an order - First used for Click and Collect Now.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="orderNumber" type="pcp:orderNumberType"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="collectionStatus" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The status of order items to be collected by a customer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="createdTimestamp" type="xsd:dateTime"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The time at which the event occurred, e.g. time of collection or the time the order items were picked.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderLine" type="mod:orderLineType" minOccurs="0" </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="proxyDetailsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details of the person picking up the order in place of the person who made the order</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="name"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Custom field name e.g. order_despatch_date</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="200"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="proxyAddress"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Address of the person picking up the order in place of the person who placed the order</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="255"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="telephoneNumber" type="xsd:string"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="proofIdentityType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Proof of Identity information provided by the customer upon collection of their order. For other collection statuses, it is not necessary to supply the SSN.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="assignedProductNumber" type="pcp:assignedProductNumberType"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="msisdn" type="xcore:msisdnType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ssn" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Sim Serial Number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="getOrderList_3Response"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Response to request for order list for a particular customer. Denotes whether this relates to a Click and Collect Now order</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:enumeration value="N"/> <xsd:enumeration value="Y"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="collectionStatus" maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The status of order items to be collected by a customer</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="50"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="storeNumber" type="xsd:string" maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="getOrderList_3"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Request the list of orders that meet the given selection criteria.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="commonRegistrationId" type="mod:portalEmailType"/> <xsd:element name="customerNumber" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The identifier for the customer.The Horizon Customer Number for the Legal Entity.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="msisdn" type="xcore:msisdnType"/> <xsd:element name="ordersByParcelNumber"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The list of orders of any type based on parcel number. Likely to return zero or one order records only.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="parcelNumber" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Contains the courier's parcel shipping reference number for this order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ordersForInStoreCollection" type="mod:ordersForInStoreCollectionType"/> </xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="rowSelectionCriteria" type="mod:ordersSelectionCriteriaType"/> <xsd:element name="returnStoreNumber" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo" maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ordersForInStoreCollectionType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This section allows a retail store to list orders to be collected. This is a 4 digit number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ordersByCustomerSurname"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Search based on Customer Surname.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="partySurname" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The customers Surname.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="postcode" type="pcp:postcode" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The customers address postcode.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:choice> <xsd:choice> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="isClickAndCollect" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo"/> <xsd:element name="isClickAndCollectNow" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="isAnyOrderType" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo"/> </xsd:choice> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="getOrderDetails_3"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation should retrieve the details of an order for an order identifier, provided an order is associated with the given order identifier.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="orderNumber" type="pcp:orderNumberType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Order number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="msisdn" type="xcore:msisdnType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Mobile Phone Number. This (or orderNumber) is the key for the order that will be returned.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="paymentReferenceNumber" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A unique identifier provided by the payment service provider.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:choice> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="getOrderDetails_3Response"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Following are the optional details of an order returned, if an order is associated with the order number or msisdn (mobile phone number) or paymentReferenceNumber, which can be a post pay, prepay or DISE. 1. General information about the order including the total order amount, order status and the portal id of the user who placed the order. 2. Package(s) and items associated with packages. 3. Payment in advance details 4. Delivery address details 5. Information about the credit check activity done as part of placing the order 6. Recurring payment details for paying for the order in instalments or periodic payments.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="responseCode" type="xsd:string"/> History events for the Order. Most recent events come first.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="createdTimestamp" type="xsd:dateTime"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date time the event was created.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="createdBy" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Username or system (e.g. NDC) that made the last update.From bo_order_history.created_user.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderEvent" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Description of order status. Will contain the text “COMMENT” if it is a legacy ‘comment’ entry, which historically had an order_state of –1 in BV.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderEventDescription" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>User friendly description of the order event.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="deleted" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>If order history row is flagged as deleted then the UI shows the row with a strike-through.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="lastUpdated" type="xsd:dateTime" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date and time when a set of data items/record was last updated.Formerly, when this order history record was last updated.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="lastUpdatedBy" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The last person to update this order history event.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="freeFormText" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Gives further details regarding the Order History Event.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="upgradeOfferDetailsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details of the Upgrade Entitlement that was offerred to the customer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="msisdn" type="xcore:msisdnType"/> <xsd:element name="channel" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details the channel from which the message originated, e.g. AFU or CFU.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="storeType" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of store. Either O2, O2 Franchise or Independent.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="retailerId" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Retailer ID of the retailer taking the order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="userId" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the system consuming the service for which statistics data is being provided, e.g. 'MyO2' for the Restful Gateway.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="upgradeEntitlementReference" type="xsd:long"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Unique ID to identify the upgrade entitlement request (v4 onwards).</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="tariffProductId" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The internal tariff identifier.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="tenure" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Number of months since the last upgrade date, or if the customer hasn't upgraded it's the number of months since the phone was activated.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="contractStartDate" type="xsd:date" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date the contract started.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="contractEndDate" type="xsd:date" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date the contract will end.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="serviceTenure" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The total number of months this service has been with O2, including times of disconnection.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="lastUpgradeDate" type="xsd:date" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date of the last upgrade. In the format: ccyy-mm-dd.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="currentMonthlySpend" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The total monthly spend for the msisdn, includes the cost of the base tariff and any CCA installment.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="eligibleForUpgrade" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Flag to determine whether a customer is eligible for any upgrade on the current date.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="upgradeAvailable" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of upgrade available to the customer today, could be NONE, PAID or FREE.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="overrideAllowed" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Y/N flag that indicates whether the channel submitting the request can override the upgrade offers made or not.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="upgradeOfferExpiry" type="xsd:dateTime"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date and time when the upgrade offer expires .</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="upgradeOptions" type="mod:upgradeOptionsType" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xsd:element name="upgradePayment" type="mod:upgradePaymentType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="upgradePaymentType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details of any payment required in order to allow an Upgrade Order to be placed. For example, the amount required to clear an exisitng CCA.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:choice> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="CCANumber" type="pcp:CCANumberType"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="CCASettlementAmount" type="pcp:settlementAmountType"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="isCCAPaymentAllowed" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo"></xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="earlyUpgradeFee" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Early upgrade amount paid in pence (inclusive of VAT).</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="isFTUPaymentAllowed" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo"></xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:choice> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="upgradeOptionsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Upgrade options that were given.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="upgradeType" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of upgrade offered to a customer, options are SIMO, HANDSET and CCA.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="isUpgradeAllowed" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Y/N flag that indicates whether the channel submitting the request can submit an upgrade order for the specified upgrade type.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="onAccountPaymentAccepted" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Determines whether the customer can billany hardware costs from the upgrade to their account. This will be set to N for all early upgrades and Y for standard and enhanced upgrades.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="standardUpgradeDetails" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="upgradeEligibilityDate" type="xsd:date"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A date at which upgrade is possible.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="paidUpgradeDetails" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="upgradeEligibilityDate" type="xsd:date"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A date at which upgrade is possible.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="upgradeDetails_3Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details of the Upgrade particulars, only present if the Order is an Upgrade.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="msisdnDetails"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="upgradeMSISDN" type="xcore:msisdnType"/> <xsd:element name="msisdn" type="xcore:msisdnType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="upgradeDiscounts" type="mod:upgradeDiscountsType"/> <xsd:element name="upgradeEntitlementDetails" type="mod:upgradeEntitlementDetails_2Type" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="creditCheckDetails_3Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This field should be populated if we have information resulting of a Credit Check call to a Credit Bureau.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="orderCreditCheckStatus" type="pcp:creditCheckStatusType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:sequence minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>If credit Vet Was made sucessfully.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:element name="creditVetNumber" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is the internal Id used by the credit bureau to track the application, Mandatory If credit Vet was done.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="creditScore" type="pcp:creditScoreType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="lastCreditCheckDate" type="xsd:date" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Date the credit check was last performed. Mandatory if credit Vet call has been done.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="creditClassId" type="pcp:creditClassIdType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="depositDetails" type="mod:depositDetails_3Type" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="transactCreditCheckDetails" type="mod:transactCreditCheckDetails_3Type" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="legalEntityAddress"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Address of the legal entity placing the order. For a business order it will be the company. For a consumer it will be the orderer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="legalEntityCustomerName" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>maximum value of 327 (comprising of title + space + forename + space + surname = a maximum of 20 + 1 + 255 + 1 + 50 = 327 - for consumers) Non Consumer type customers would have there Company_name put in the field.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="standardAddress" type="mod:standardAddressType"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="previousAddress" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="standardAddress" type="mod:standardAddressType"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="referralReason" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="depositDetails_3Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Information about any deposits done on the order</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="depositType" type="pcp:depositKindType"/> <xsd:element name="depositAmount" type="pcp:paymentMoneyType"/> <xsd:element name="depositDuration" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="depositReference" type="pcp:depositReferenceType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="transactCreditCheckDetails_3Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Extra Details of the Credit Check. Returned by Transact.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="creditCheckResultCode" type="pcp:creditCheckResultCodeType"/> <xsd:element name="totalMonthlyCharge" type="pcp:totalMonthlyChargeType"/> <xsd:element name="creditLimit" type="pcp:creditLimitType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="deliveryDetails_3Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Should only be populated if physical items are needed to be dispatched, for example in an online situation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:choice minOccurs="0"> <xsd:element name="chargeableDeliveryOption"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Chargeable delivery option, for the order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="deliveryDate" type="xsd:date"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Valid delivery date for the requested by the customer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="timeslot" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Delivery option code that is valid for a given delivery date.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="despatchDate" type="xsd:date" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Date that the despatch note for this order was generated.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="isStandardDeliveryOption" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo"></xsd:element> </xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="requestedCarrier" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Carrier requested when the Order was placed.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="destinationName" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Delivery destination, name of person. Default is the user name.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="deliveryContactNumber" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Phone contact for the delivery - Alphanumeric free text.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="standardAddress" type="mod:standardAddressType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="deliveryAddressModified" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="storeDetails" type="mod:storeDetailsType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="despatchDetails" type="mod:despatchDetailsType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"></xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="despatchDetailsType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="parcelNumber" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Contains the courier's parcel shipping reference number for this order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="actualCarrier" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Name of the carrier transporting the goods to the customer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="actualServiceType" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The actual carrier making the delivery, e.g. ROYAL MAIL or SECURICOR.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="despatchDate" type="xsd:date" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Date that the despatch note for this order was generated.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="despatchReference" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A unique reference allowing a parcel to be identified, but not the parcel number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="storeReceivedTimestamp" type="xsd:dateTime" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>When the Store received the item.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="customerCollectedTimestamp" type="xsd:dateTime" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>When the Customer picked the item up from the Store.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="storeReturnedTimestamp" type="xsd:dateTime" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>When the Customer returned the item to the Store.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="standardAddressType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Standard address information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="addressStatus" type="xsd:short" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Numeric code for the address status e.g. 0 - "Entered Manually" 1 - "Equifax Down" 2 - "Equifax Validated" 3 - "Not Entered”. External systems will hold the textual descriptions for these codes locally.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="houseNameOrNumber" type="pcp:houseNameOrNumber" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="street" type="pcp:streetType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="city" type="pcp:cityType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="county" type="pcp:countyType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="country" type="pcp:alpha2CountryCodeType"/> <xsd:element name="postcode" type="pcp:postcode"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="saleableProductDetailsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The salebale products that have been brought. Relates to the products within the catologue. Every install must have a least one of these.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="saleableProductLineNumber" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Generated by the client to differentiate each saleable product in an order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="saleableProductId" type="pcp:itemIdType"/> <xsd:element name="saleableProductName" type="pcp:saleableProductNameType"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="saleableProductPrice" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The price of the saleable product in pence. Therefore 500 equates to £5.00.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="originalPrice" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The original NON DISCOUNTED price for the saleable product. This price includes VAT. This price may be compared to the original price to determine if a discount has been given. Introduced for Retentions.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="vatDetails" type="mod:vatDetailsType"/> <xsd:element name="billingAccountNumber" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The billing account number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="billingCrossChargeAccountNumber" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Geneva cross charge account number as known to Geneva.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="assignedProduct" type="mod:assignedProductType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="assignedProductType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Assigned Products for mobile services, includign pre pay and mobile broadband. Any of the child groups below this level can be combined with any others.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="accessoryDetails" type="mod:accessoryDetailsType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xsd:element name="adjustmentDetails" type="mod:adjustmentDetailsType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xsd:element name="handsetDetails" type="mod:handsetDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="literatureDetails" type="mod:literatureDetailsType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xsd:element name="postPaySimDetails" type="mod:postPaySimDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="postPayTariffDetails" type="mod:postPayTariffDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="prePaySimDetails" type="mod:prePaySimDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="prePayTariffDetails" type="mod:prePayTariffDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="chargeableDeliveryDetails" type="mod:chargeableDeliveryDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="postPayInsuranceDetails" type="mod:postPayInsuranceDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="prePayInsuranceDetails" type="mod:prePayInsuranceDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="standardDeliveryDetails" type="mod:standardDeliveryDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="standardDeliveryDetailsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details of the standard delivery charge. The actual details of timeslots and address details are held in the delivery details section on the main branch. This section is just for charging purposes. Only used for online where the customer has not received the goods.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="category" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Category of the item. ACC =ACCESSORY, CDO=CHARGEABLE DELIVERY OPTION CON= CONSULTANCY, HAN = HANDSET, L2M = BULK LAND TO MOBILE, LIT =LITERATURE, POL = POSTPAY LOGICAL PRODUCT, POI = POSTPAY INSURANCE POS = POSTPAY SIM, POT = POSTPAY TARIFF, PRI = PREPAY INSURANCE, PRL = PREPAY LOGICAL PRODUCT, PRS = PREPAY SIM, PRT = PREPAY TARIFF, PTM = PREMIER TEXT MESSAGING, REV =SOFTWARE REVALIDATION SAD = SOURCE ADDRESS, SDC = STANDARD DELIVERY CHARGE, TAM = Tariff Modifier.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="groupId" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Allows multiple products to be associated together (e.g. a handset, sim and tariff). It has to be unique at an order level and across saleable products. It may be null for a charger for example.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="productId" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The catalogue identifier for a product.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="productName" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The product name.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="assignedProductNumber" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Differentiates each assigned product under a saleable product. Must be unique under each saleable product.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderProductPrice" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The products one off charge in pence.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="prePayInsuranceDetailsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details needed for an insurance related to a pre pay account. NOTE pre pay doesn't refer to how the insurance has will be paid for but the type of msisdn it's related to. If client chooses to change insurance two options are available. A straightforward cancel of the existing insurance. Or the client may add insurance. If the client chooses this option if there is any existing insurance it will be removed and replaced with the new insurance</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="category" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Category of the item. ACC =ACCESSORY, CDO=CHARGEABLE DELIVERY OPTION CON= CONSULTANCY, HAN = HANDSET, L2M = BULK LAND TO MOBILE, LIT =LITERATURE, POL = POSTPAY LOGICAL PRODUCT, POI = POSTPAY INSURANCE POS = POSTPAY SIM, POT = POSTPAY TARIFF, PRI = PREPAY INSURANCE, PRL = PREPAY LOGICAL PRODUCT, PRS = PREPAY SIM, PRT = PREPAY TARIFF, PTM = PREMIER TEXT MESSAGING, REV =SOFTWARE REVALIDATION SAD = SOURCE ADDRESS, SDC = STANDARD DELIVERY CHARGE, TAM = Tariff Modifier.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="groupId" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Allows multiple products to be associated together (e.g. a handset, sim and tariff). It has to be unique at an order level and across saleable products. It may be null for a charger for example.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="productId" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The catalogue identifier for a product.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="productName" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The product name.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="assignedProductNumber" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Differentiates each assigned product under a saleable product. Must be unique under each saleable product.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="imei" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Each phone is identified by an International Mobile Equipment Identity number (IMEI) that is permanently stored in the phone.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="msisdn" type="xcore:msisdnType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="serialNumber" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Serial number of item.Type of serial number is indicated in serial number type field but will contain the IMEI for handset order lines and SSNs for SIM card order lines.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="cancelExistingInsurance"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="insuranceEndDate" type="xsd:dateTime"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date time that an the insurance product ceases or is cancelled.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="addNewInsurance"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="assignedProductBillingFreq" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The billing frequency used when billing for an assigned product. Currently only used for insurance products. O - One Off M - Monthly Recurring.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:choice> <xsd:choice minOccurs="0"> <xsd:element name="orderProductPrice" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The products one off charge in pence.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderProductCharge" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The products recurring payment's in pence, eg: monthly charges.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:choice> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="postPayInsuranceDetailsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details needed for an insurance related to a post pay account. NOTE post pay doesn't refer to how the insurance has will be paid for but the type of msisdn it's related to. If client chooses to change insurance two options are available. A straightforward cancel of the existing insurance. Or the client may add insurance. If the client chooses this option if there is any existing insurance it will be removed and replaced with the new insurance.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="category" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Category of the item. It may be null for a charger for example.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="productName" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The product name.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="creditOrDebit" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates if this is a credit or a debit.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="adjustmentAmount" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The +value of the credit or debit. Geneva will multiply this value by -1 if a the adjustmentkind is a debit.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="adjustmentReason" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Canonical indication of why a billling account credit or debit adjustment was made.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="adjustmentCircumstances" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>CSA can record a note against the adjustment Note Geneva can store upto 255, limit this string to 200 chars in order to potentially reserve space for CSAID to be appended and stored in Geneva.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="accessoryDetailsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details need for accessories.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="category" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Category of the item. ACC =ACCESSORY, CDO=CHARGEABLE DELIVERY OPTION CON= CONSULTANCY, HAN = HANDSET, L2M = BULK LAND TO MOBILE, LIT =LITERATURE, POL = POSTPAY LOGICAL PRODUCT, POI = POSTPAY INSURANCE POS = POSTPAY SIM, POT = POSTPAY TARIFF, PRI = PREPAY INSURANCE, PRL = PREPAY LOGICAL PRODUCT, PRS = PREPAY SIM, PRT = PREPAY TARIFF, PTM = PREMIER TEXT MESSAGING, REV =SOFTWARE REVALIDATION SAD = SOURCE ADDRESS, SDC = STANDARD DELIVERY CHARGE, TAM = Tariff Modifier.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="groupId" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Allows multiple products to be associated together (e.g. a handset, sim and tariff). It has to be unique at an order level and across saleable products. It may be null for a charger for example.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="dispatchMethod" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The method used to dispatch the product. Allowed values are: IMMD = Immediate Dispatch EXCH = Wait On Exchange RETL = Pick Up In Retail INFO = No Dispatch Required DSEX = Doorstep Exchange.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="productId" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The catalogue identifier for a product.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="productName" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The product name.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="assignedProductNumber" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Differentiates each assigned product under a saleable product. Must be unique under each saleable product.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="make" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Make of the a generic piece of Hardware.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="model" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Model of the a generic piece of Hardware.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="risk" type="pcp:riskType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Model of the a generic piece of Hardware.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="skuId" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The unique identifier of the SKU (Stock Keeping Unit).Nillable - Where the SKU cannot be identified this value will be set to UNKNOWN. Element will be empty if the Empty Bag Indicator is set.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="skuName" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the Stock Keeping Unit (SKU).</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="serialNumber" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Serial number of item.Type of serial number is indicated in serial number type field but will contain the IMEI for handset order lines and SSNs for SIM card order lines.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="imei" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Each phone is identified by an International Mobile Equipment Identity number (IMEI) that is permanently stored in the phone.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="dispatchStatus" type="pcp:dispatchStatusType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The status of the assigned product on an order. 0 = Dispatch Requested 1 = Cancelled 2 = Cancelling 3 = Dispatch Not Cancelled 4 = Allocate Not Cancelled 5 = Dispatch Required 10 = Dispatched 11 = Allocated 12 = Deallocated 13 = Out Of Stock 99 = Dispatch Not Required.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderProductPrice" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The products one off charge in pence.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="replacementReturnDetails" type="mod:replacementReturnDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="assignedProdReturnDetails" type="mod:assignedProdReturnDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="assignedProdReturnDetailsType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="returnReasonCode" type="pcp:returnReasonCodeType"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="returnReasonDescription" type="pcp:returnReasonDescriptionType"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="returnReasonSubTypeCode" type="pcp:returnReasonSubTypeCodeType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="returnReasonSubTypeDescription" type="pcp:returnReasonSubTypeDescriptionType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="replacementMethod" type="pcp:replacementMethodType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="returnNotes" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Free text field containing reason for return (order level).</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="returnCondition" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The code for the return condition of an item.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="returnTimestamp" type="xsd:dateTime" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date and time the phyiscal item has been returned.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="returnAuthorisationNumber" type="pcp:returnAuthorisationNumberType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="replacedByOrderNumber" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The order number from the order which replaced the product.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="replacedByOrderLineNumber" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The saleable product line number from within the order which replaced the product.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="replacedByOrderAssignProdNumber" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The assigned product number from the order which replaced the product.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="replacementPolicyId" type="pcp:replacementPolicyIdType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="replacementPolicySOACode" type="pcp:replacementPolicyCodeType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="replacementReturnDetailsType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="orderNumberBeingReturned" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This order number relates to the previous order containing the hardware which is now being returned.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="returnSaleableProductLineNumber" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The line number from the original order of the item that is being returned.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="returnAssignedProductNumber" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The assign number from the original order of the item that is being returned.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="returnReasonCode" type="pcp:returnReasonCodeType" maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="returnReasonSubTypeCode" type="pcp:returnReasonSubTypeCodeType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="returnReasonOutOfPolicyUserName" type="pcp:returnReasonOutOfPolicyUserNameType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="returnAuthorisationNumber" type="pcp:returnAuthorisationNumberType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="returnNotes" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Free text field containing reason for return (order level).</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="replacementPolicyId" type="pcp:replacementPolicyIdType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="replacementPolicySOACode" type="pcp:replacementPolicyCodeType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="vatDetailsType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="vatRate" type="xsd:double"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Value Added Tax (VAT) rate.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="vatAmount" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Value Added Tax (VAT) amount. In pence, therefore 500 equates to £5.00.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="vatExclusivePrice" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The individual cost of the saleable product. This is the cost to the customer excluding VAT but including any discounts. In pence, therefore 500 equates to £5.00.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="vatReversalReceiptStatus" type="pcp:vatReversalReceiptStatusType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="recurringPaymentDetails_3Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details of the recurring payment applicable to the </xsd:choice> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="newAccount_3Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Create a new Billing account to associate the order to.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="billingAccountNumber" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The billing account number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="billingCustomerNumber" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Geneva customeraccount number as known to Geneva.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="accountRecurringPaymentDetails" type="mod:accountRecurringPaymentDetails_3Type"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="accountRecurringPaymentDetails_3Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The account recurring payment can either be made using a credit card or direct debit.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="accountContinuousCCAuthority" type="mod:accountContinuousCCAuthorityType"/> <xsd:element name="accountDirectDebitDetails" type="mod:accountDirectDebitDetailsType"/> <xsd:element name="continuousChequePayments" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A single 'Y' character identifying that the customer is going to make recurring payments by cheque.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:choice> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="accountContinuousCCAuthorityType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This field contains bank information used if the continuous payments will be made by Credit Card.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element type of the card used (Debit or Credit).</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="existingAccount_3Type"> <xsd:annotation> contains an update to the Direct Debit payment details for the Billing Account.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="userAccountNumber" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The raw user-entered bank account number, i.e. this is their bank account number as far as the customer is concerned. Stored in encrypted format.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="bankAccountNumber" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The transcribed bank account number in BACS format, i.e. this value is returned by the Mod Check in Barron McCann. Stored in encrypted format.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="bankSortCode" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Bank Account sort code.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="bankAccountName" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The customer name defined on the Bank Account.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="initialPaymentDetails_3Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is for any additonal charges that have already been taken. For example for additional hardware charges.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:choice> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="cardDetails" type="mod:cardDetails_3Type"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="paymentDetails" type="mod:paymentDetails_3Type"></xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="paymentReferenceNumber" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A unique identifier provided by the payment service provider.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="cardToken" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Card token that can be used to retrieve card details Card token that can be used to retrieve card details.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="externalPaymentId" type="pcp:externalPaymentIdType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="billingAccountNumber" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The billing account number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="paymentMoney" type="pcp:paymentMoneyType"></xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="paymentDetails_3Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is the payment result returned by the Payment entity.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="authorisationStatus" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The result of an authorisation. Meaning is 2 = Declined, 5 = Referred, 6 = Authorised, 0, 1, 3 and 4 = Not Done. Historically '-1' = Processed Before. Maps to EAI OIP DB ORDER.AUTH_STATUS.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="authorisationRespCode" type="pcp:authorisationRespCodeType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="authorisationRespMessage" type="pcp:authorisationRespMessageType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="authorisationCode" type="pcp:authorisationCodeType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="authMessage" type="pcp:authMessageType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="buynetId" type="pcp:buynetIdType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="settlementRespCode" type="xsd:short" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Code between the numbers 000 – 913. If this code is null, the settle has not been performed.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="cardDetails_3Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Bank Card details</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="cardNumber" type="xcore:maskedCardNumberType"/> <xsd:element name="cardExpiryDate" type="xcore:cardExpiryDateType"/> <xsd:element name="cardHolderName" type="xcore:cardHolderNameType"/> <xsd:element name="cardIssueDate" type="xcore:cardIssueDateType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="cardIssueNumber" type="xcore:cardIssueNumberType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="postCode" type="xcore:postcodeType"/> <xsd:element name="houseNameOrNumber" type="pcp:houseNameOrNumber" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="bankCardIssuer" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Textual description of the card issuer - e.g. MAESTRO, SOLO, VISA, DELTA, AMEX.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="orderReturnDetails_3Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Order level Returns details.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="returnsOutstanding" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Flag indicating whether or not there are outstanding returns on an order (Y/N). Field will be N if no returns have been requested.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="returnReason" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Reason for return, this is the high level return reason for example the code for Change of mind.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="returnNotes" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Free text field containing reason for return (order level).</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="orderSourceDetails_3Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details of whom and from where the order originated.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="orderMethod" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The following are the allowed values: RT – Retail TS – Telesales OL – Online (default) IA IT</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="partner" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation/> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="owningBusinessDivision" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>O2 Business that own the order Either O2UK or O2ONLINE.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="sourceOfSale" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies a sales channel, online, RFE, ESME etc.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="retailerId" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Retailer ID of the retailer taking the order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="posBusinessUnit" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Point of Sale business unit.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="storeName" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the store as known to Telefonica.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> Either O2, O2 Franchise or Independent.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="salesPerson" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An identifier for the person who made the sale.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="salesManager" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> to identify the initiator of an activity, ususally a CSAs Id.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="userAlias" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> name="callContactID" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifier to associate a customer contact message (within the customer Contact system) with actions taken in Address was issued. e.g. Date on a Utility Bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="proofOfIdentityType"> <xsd:annotation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="orderNumber" type="pcp:orderNumberType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The External Order Number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:element name="orderType" type="pcp:orderType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The following are the different order types, NE - New Order RE - Replacement UG - Upgrade ES - ESME sales order EC - ESME change request</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderStatus" type="pcp:orderStatusType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Describes the status of order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="linkedOrderNum" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="preOrderOfferingId" type="xsd:integer" name="mostRecentOrderEventType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation/> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="orderEvent" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> orderNumber provided in the request will resume processing. Successul Transcation is indicated by backendResponse element acceptStatus, Once its recieved success response is mapped in SOA.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="result" type="xcore:ServiceResultType"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="getOrderList"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The search is performed either on user's portalid, orange customer number or msisdn. In order to paginate the start position of the page and the page size needs to be provided to this operation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="portalId" type="xcore:portalIDType"/> <xsd:element name="customerNumber" type="pcp:typeHorizonCustomerNumber"/> <xsd:element name="msisdn" type="xcore:msisdnType"/> </xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="isArchiveOrderRequired" type="mod:isArchiveOrderRequiredType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="ordersSelectionCriteria" type="mod:ordersSelectionCriteriaType"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="getOrderList_2"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The search is performed either on user's portalid, orange customer number or msisdn. In order to paginate the start position of the page and the page size needs to be provided to this operation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="portalRegisterationDetails" type="pcp:portalRegistationIdDetailsType"/> <xsd:element name="customerNumber" type="pcp:typeHorizonCustomerNumber"/> <xsd:element name="msisdn" type="xcore:msisdnType"/> </xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="isArchiveOrderRequired" type="mod:isArchiveOrderRequiredType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="ordersSelectionCriteria" type="mod:ordersSelectionCriteriaType"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ordersSelectionCriteriaType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>In order to paginate the start position of the page and the page size needs to be provided to this operation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="startOrderNumber" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Start position of the first page of results.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="numOrdersRequired" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Number of orders required to be retrieved.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="getOrderListResponse"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation must retrieve a list of orders if one or more orders are associated with the user portal id, orange customer number or msisdn (mobile phone number). The orders should be retrieved in a chronologically descending order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="totalOrders" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Total number of orders found for the search critera.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ordersReturned" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Number of orders returned.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="order" type="mod:orderSummaryType" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Order List</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="getOrderList_2Response"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation must retrieve a list of orders if one or more orders are associated with the user portal id, orange customer number or msisdn (mobile phone number). The orders should be retrieved in a chronologically descending order. This operation will also return the early upgarde fee inclusive of the VAT incase paid for the order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="totalOrders" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Total number of orders found for the search critera.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ordersReturned" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Number of orders returned.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="order" type="mod:order_2SummaryType" maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Order List</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="orderSummaryType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Order List</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="orderNumber" type="pcp:orderNumberType"/> <xsd:element name="orderId" type="xsd:string"/> <xsd:element name="orderType" type="pcp:orderType"/> <xsd:element name="packageName" type="mod:packageName" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This will be either the package name or the item name if the item was a stand-alone item (ie not part of a package). e.g. Nokia 6210 Football Special, Siemens C35i base etc.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderDate" type="xsd:dateTime"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Date on which the order was placed.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderStatus" type="pcp:orderStatusType"/> <xsd:element name="returnsOutstanding" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates whether there are any outstanding SKUs marked for return on this order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="partner" type="pcp:partnerType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Description of partner.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="isOrderArchive" type="xsd:boolean" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A flag indicating whether this order is an archive order or not.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="order_2SummaryType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Order List inclusive of the upgrade fee.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="orderNumber" type="pcp:orderNumberType"/> <xsd:element name="orderId" type="xsd:string"/> <xsd:element name="orderType" type="pcp:orderType"/> <xsd:element name="packageName" type="mod:packageName" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This will be either the package name or the item name if the item was a stand-alone item (ie not part of a package). e.g. Nokia 6210 Football Special, Siemens C35i base etc.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderDate" type="xsd:dateTime"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Date on which the order was placed.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderStatus" type="pcp:orderStatusType"/> <xsd:element name="returnsOutstanding" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates whether there are any outstanding SKUs marked for return on this order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="partner" type="pcp:partnerType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Description of partner.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="earlyUpgradeFee" type="pcp:paymentMoneyType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The upgrade fee payed by the customer, inclusive of the VAT amount. The element is populated only in case of the getOrderList_2 operatrion.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="isOrderArchive" type="xsd:boolean" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A flag indicating whether this order is an archive order or not.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleType name="packageName"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Package is nothing but a saleable product. It will be a concatenation of all item (assigned product) names that this package (saleable product) consists of.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="500"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:complexType name="getOrderDetails"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation should retrieve the details of an order for an order identifier, provided an order is associated with the given order identifier.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="userId" type="pcp:csaIdType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>It is the unique user id which is used to identify the initiator of the activity. For example customer service advisors will use their user Ids (csaId) to query the order details information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="orderNumber" type="pcp:orderNumberType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Order number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="msisdn" type="xcore:msisdnType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Mobile Phone Number. This (or orderNumber) is the key for the order that will be returned.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="isArchiveOrderRequired" type="mod:isArchiveOrderRequiredType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="getOrderDetails_2"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation should retrieve the details of an order for an order identifier, provided an order is associated with the given order identifier.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="userId" type="pcp:csaIdType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>It is the unique user id which is used to identify the initiator of the activity. For example customer service advisors will use their user Ids (csaId) to query the order details information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="orderNumber" type="pcp:orderNumberType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Order number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="msisdn" type="xcore:msisdnType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Mobile Phone Number. This (or orderNumber) is the key for the order that will be returned.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="isArchiveOrderRequired" type="mod:isArchiveOrderRequiredType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="getOrderDetailsResponse"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Following are the optional details of an order returned, if an order is associated with the order number or msisdn (mobile phone number), which can be a post pay, prepay or DISE. 1. General information about the order including the total order amount, order status and the portal id of the user who placed the order. 2. Package(s) and items associated with packages. 3. Payment in advance details 4. Delivery address details 5. Information about the credit check activity done as part of placing the order 6. Recurring payment details for paying for the order in instalments or periodic payments.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="responseCode" type="xsd:string"/> <xsd:element name="orderHeaderDetails" type="mod:orderHeaderDetailsType"/> <xsd:element name="orderDetails" type="mod:orderDetailsType"/> <xsd:element name="oneOffPaymentDetails" type="mod:oneOffPaymentDetailsType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is for the scenarios where Customer has paid for all or part of the order up front using a credit, debit card or assigned it to their post pay account. This will be populated in cases where handset or accessories have been purchased.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="deliveryDetails" type="mod:deliveryDetailsType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is the delivery details for the order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="creditCheckInfo" type="mod:creditCheckInfoType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The activity performed to check the credit capability of the customer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="recurringPaymentdetails" type="mod:recurringPaymentDetailsType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This contains the details of the recurring payment for each Geneva account.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="getOrderDetails_2Response"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Following are the optional details of an order returned, if an order is associated with the order number or msisdn (mobile phone number), which can be a post pay, prepay or DISE. 1. General information about the order including the total order amount, order status and the portal id of the user who placed the order. 2. Package(s) and items associated with packages. 3. Payment in advance details 4. Delivery address details 5. Information about the credit check activity done as part of placing the order 6. Recurring payment details for paying for the order in instalments or periodic payments.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="responseCode" type="xsd:string"/> <xsd:element name="orderHeaderDetails" type="mod:orderHeaderDetails_2Type"/> <xsd:element name="orderDetails" type="mod:orderDetailsType"/> <xsd:element name="oneOffPaymentDetails" type="mod:oneOffPaymentDetailsType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is for the scenarios where Customer has paid for all or part of the order up front using a credit, debit card or assigned it to their post pay account. This will be populated in cases where handset or accessories have been purchased.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="deliveryDetails" type="mod:deliveryDetailsType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is the delivery details for the order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="creditCheckInfo" type="mod:creditCheckInfoType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The activity performed to check the credit capability of the customer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="recurringPaymentdetails" type="mod:recurringPaymentDetailsType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This contains the details of the recurring payment for each Geneva account.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="setConsignmentStateInOrder_1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation is used to update the status of each consignment of an order from stores.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="orderNumber" type="mod:orderNumberType" maxOccurs="1"/> <xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="consignmentNumber" type="mod:consignmentNumberType" maxOccurs="1"/> <xsd:element name="dispatchReference" type="xsd:string" maxOccurs="1"/> </xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="orderStatus" type="mod:orderStatusType" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xsd:element name="updatedDateTime" type="xsd:dateTime" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xsd:element name="source" type="mod:sourceType" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="setConsignmentStateInOrder_1Response"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Response indicating the action for setting the status.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="result" type="xcore:ServiceResultType"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="recurringPaymentDetailsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This contains the details of the recurring payment for each Geneva account. There are four options for payment: bank, credit card, MTBilling and Geneva account. This will need to have a payment type defined and the geneva account number identifying the acount it refers to.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="cardNumber" type="xcore:maskedCardNumberType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="cardDetails" type="mod:creditCardDetailsType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Credit card details of the card used for the payment mandate of the account.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="accountNumber" type="xcore:billingAccountNumberType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Geneva account number that the order corresponds to.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="bankDetails" type="mod:bankAccountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>User acc (as typed in by Care screens), Bank acc (as returned by BMC), sort code and name.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="paymentMethod" type="pcp:paymentMethodType"/> <xsd:element name="bmcFailureReason" type="pcp:stringSize255" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Barron McCann failure string if card number or bank details fail CareX checks and they want to force the use of card no or bank details.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="billStyle" type="mod:billStyleDetailType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="billStyleDetailType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Bill style details.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="isBillItemised" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Y/N if the bill is itemised.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="isPaperBill" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Y/N to Paper Bill Required.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="bankAccountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Representation of bank details, including account holder name, sort code and account number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="userAccountNumber" type="xcore:maskedBankAccountNumberType"/> <xsd:element name="bankAccountNumber" type="xcore:maskedBankAccountNumberType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="bankSortCode" type="xcore:bankSortCodeType"/> <xsd:element name="bankAccountHolder" type="xcore:bankAccountHolderNameType"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="creditCheckInfoType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Representation of information required for credit check details.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="previousAddress" type="mod:previousAddressType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="legalEntityAddress" type="mod:legalEntityAddressType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Address of the legal entity placing the order. For a business order, it will be the company and for a consumer, it will be the orderer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="creditCheckDetails" type="mod:creditCheckDetailsType"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="legalEntityAddressType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Address of the legal entity placing the order. For a business order it will be the company. For a consumer it will be the orderer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="legalEntityName" type="mod:legalEntityNameType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Maximum value of 327 (comprising of title + space + forename + space + surname = a maximum of 20 + 1 + 255 + 1 + 50 = 327 - for consumers). Non Consumer type customers would have their Company Name put in the field.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="basicAddress" type="mod:basicAddressType"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleType name="legalEntityNameType"> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="327"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:complexType name="previousAddressType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Previous address details.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="addressStatus" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Address status.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="basicAddress" type="mod:basicAddressType"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="creditCheckDetailsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Credit check details including the status of credit check, vet number, score and last credit check date.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="status" type="mod:creditCheckStatusType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>1 -
